Localization
"FPS, or Frames Per Second, serves as a measure of your device's performance. A higher FPS value results in a smoother display of images on your screen.

Setting a limit on FPS can be beneficial in reducing energy consumption and load on your device.
To assess FPS with various graphics settings, simply click the ""{#140}"" button.

{#85}If the actual FPS doesn't align with your game settings, it's advisable to review your device's screen settings. Make sure to set the refresh rate to 60 Hz or activate the ""{#530}"" mode in the game for optimal performance."

{0}d {1:D2}h
We tried to build a new, perfect world without wars and violence. But today, we must rise in arms against the global threat. We have advanced technologies and the most powerful military vehicles.
We are the liberation army that fights for freedom, justice, and human rights. Our strength lies in speed, stealth, and surprise. Our weapons are reliable and tested over time.
Your choice is not final. You can switch between factions at any time.
Watch out for scammers. Avoid visiting third-party websites or using messaging apps. Never share personal data used to log in to the game. Participating in account sales or suspicious activities will result in the account being blocked.
"Would you mind helping us improve the game? Most of the bugs were fixed during the beta testing, but some errors can still be found in the game. Please try to understand this and help us improve the game. If you find a bug, you can report it in our social group on Facebook or through support chat in the game. Describe the bug in detail and apply a screenshot or a video to your report. The most active testers can be awarded golden credits. If a player deliberately uses any discovered errors to turn them into a benefit or otherwise disturbs the game process, their account can be reset without any compensation and prior notice.

The game supports 19 languages. The translation process is difficult. You can help us with it. If you find any mistakes or translation discrepancies, please let us know. We will fix it."

You can reset your account and restart the game from the very beginning. Profiles will be reset FOR BOTH FACTIONS. All of your progress will be lost. Purchases will not be transferred to the new account. There's no way to restore the reset account.

"If you prefer to act without hesitation, choose the Confederation. The faction features:
{#81}+ high firepower[-]
{#81}+ strong armor[-]
{#82}- low speed and maneuverability[-]"
"If you prefer to carefully calculate every action, weigh every decision, and act with foresight, pick the Resistance. This faction features:
{#81}+ stealth ability[-]
{#81}+ a large firing range[-]
{#81}+ fast and maneuverable units[-]
{#81}+ units that are produced cheaper and quicker[-]
{#82}- weaker firepower and unit armor[-]
The Resistance gives you more options to devise various interesting and unexpected tactics."

Rank required: {0}

Total mission score
The faster you complete the mission, the higher the time multiplier.
The best previous score for this mission
Your mission reward depends on the stars you earn and the difficulty level. If you complete a mission on high difficulty, the reward gets doubled. You receive a reward only if you improve on your previous score.

You get extra points for completing each secondary mission. Only completing secondary objectives will allow you to get 3 stars for the mission and claim the max reward.

Reward for winning
Offensive maneuvers and successive strikes on an enemy base provide you with activity points. Passive defense of your base reduces your activity.

This player is ignored
Do you want to add this player {#82}{0}[-] to the ignore list? If yes, you won't get any private messages or co-op battle challenges from them. You can remove a player from the list of ignored players at any time by sending them a private message.
Do you want to remove the player {#81}{0}[-] from the list of ignored players? You will get private messages and training battle challenges from them again.
Do you want to complain about this message from {#82}{0}[-]? You can complain about any message containing harshness, obscenity, abuse, etc. Once the player receives a certain number of complaints, they will be automatically banned.
"All text entered by a player in the game (chat messages, profile or clan name, clan description, etc.) must comply with the following rules. The text must not:

1) be rude, vulgar, insulting, or obscene, even in latent form;
2) offend other players' nationalities, races, or religious beliefs;
3) provoke reciprocal rudeness or insults from other players;
4) contain spam, ads, links, and information that could cause other players harm.

If these rules are violated, the administration can take preventative measures and ban the rule-breaker from chatting or the game itself.

The full text of the License Agreement is available in the SETTINGS - ABOUT section."

Welcome to the game! If you have any game-related problems or questions, submit them here. We will answer you promptly. Be sure to read the rules on the right panel.
"We'd like to have a productive dialog with you. Here are some simple rules to make it happen:

1) write your message in English; 
2) provide us detailed info on your issue to get a prompt answer; 
3) don't use rude, offensive, or abusive language; 
4) be patient. Since we process hundreds of messages daily, there's a message queue. However, we'll get to yours as quickly as possible. 

Support is entitled to disregard abusive messages. Moreover, cheaters' or rule-breakers' messages might be ignored."

"{#80}Overall win rate[-] — total percentage of victories in battles for all time. PvP and Tournament battles are counted.

TOURNAMENT RULES
"Tournaments

{#84}Tournaments are designed to identify the strongest and most experienced commanders. To win a tournament, you must gain the maximum number of {#80}Tournament Points (TP)[-].[-]

Leagues

{#84}All players in the tournament are divided into {#80}6 leagues[-] by their ranks. The winners are determined separately in each league.[-]

Training Stage

{#84}Each tournament starts with a {#80}Training Stage[-]. During the Training Stage, you can train with other players on the tournament maps. Training battles in the tournament give you rewards and stars, but they do not give you any TP.[-]

Main Stage

{#84}During the {#80}Main Stage[-], you must play the determined number of battles and earn the maximum possible TP for them. The points are given only for wins and depend on the length of the accumulated winning series (number of consecutive wins) in tournament battles. The longer your winning series is, the more points you get for each subsequent victory. A defeat in a tournament battle resets a winning series. TP also depend on the league. In the higher leagues, players receive more TP per victory.[-]

Battles

{#84}The tournament battles will start on a specified schedule. You can apply for a battle five minutes before it begins. {#1834} It is possible that the matcher cannot find an opponent for you. In that case, you will have to skip this battle and apply for the next one.[-]

Winners

{#84}The winners in each league are determined by Tournament Points. They receive medals and valuable prizes. If there are several players in a league with the same amount of TP, the winner will be the one who scored points earlier.[-]

Clans

{#84}Clans also participate in tournaments. The personal Tournament Points of all clan members are accounted for in the clan's TP.[-]

{#4915}
{#84}Every victory in the tournament gives you {#80}{#4915}[-]. You can use them to improve your Сommander's Skills in the {#80}Profile[-] menu.[-]"
Tournament Points
TP for each battle depend on the current winning series. In the event of a defeat, the winning series is reset.
"The tournament is to find the strongest players in the league.
{#7216}
The opposite faction is favored for matchmaking, but one-faction battles are acceptable as well.
{#7222}"
{#80}{#18}:[-]
"{#0}
{#1835}
 {#80}•[-] {#87}{0}[-]
 {#80}•[-] Base reward {#87}{1}[-]{#81}$[-]
 {#80}•[-] Entrance cost {#87}{2}[-]{#81}$[-]

{#7064}
 {#80}•[-] {#87}{0}[-] 
 {#80}•[-] Base reward {#87}{3}[-]{#81}$[-] 
 {#80}•[-] Entrance cost {#87}{4}[-]{#81}$[-]

{#1871}
 {#80}•[-] {#87}{0}[-]
 {#80}•[-] Base reward {#87}{5}[-]{#81}$[-]
 {#80}•[-] Entrance cost {#87}{6}[-]{#81}$[-]"
"{#0}
{#1835}
 {#80}•[-] {#672}

{#1871}

"{#84}Boosts are a strategic component of a battle. They temporarily improve various characteristics of units and buildings. Boosts allow you to accelerate the development of your base, strengthen attacks, and help you survive in difficult situations. Proper use of boosts in a battle greatly increases your chance of winning.[-]

{#84}Each boost used in a battle increases the duration of the next boosts during this battle:
 {#80}• blue boost +5%[-]
 {#82}• red boost +10%[-]
 {#83}• golden boost +20%[-]

The more boosts you use, the more effective the next one will be. The maximum total bonus is {#80}+50%[-][-]"
Significantly increases the efficiency of units in an attack. {#2080}
It allows you to train infantry quicker. To maximize the effect of the boost, you should train infantry in several Barracks at the same time.
Significantly increases the efficiency of infantry in reconnaissance. Makes it easier to find and collect containers at the beginning of a battle.
It allows you to produce {0} quicker. To maximize the effect of the boost, launch production at several {1} at the same time.
{#2073<vehicles><factories>}
{#2073<air units><avia factories>}
{#2073<naval units><shipyards>}
Use this boost to increase the reconnaissance abilities of vehicles. It's very beneficial for artillery units as well. It allows you to increase artillery effectiveness due to an increase in the sight range.
To maximize the effect of this boost, use it only after the return of the first aircraft group to the base.
Significantly increases the efficiency of the fleet in scouting. Makes it faster to find and collect resource containers at sea.
For maximum effect, use the boost just before contact with the enemy units.
Use this boost to protect your base from enemy attacks. The boost is twice as effective at resisting rush attacks during the first 10 minutes of a battle.
A universal boost for accelerating the production of all types of units. For maximum effect, order units in all the Barracks, factories, and Shipyards while the boost is active.
The boost accelerates the income of resources. To get the maximum effect, use the boost after you have built 3-4 Supply Centers.
Reduces building construction and upgrading time. For maximum effect, build several buildings simultaneously while the boost is active.
Allows you to repair your damaged buildings or units faster. Remember that if your unit or building is under attack, their health doesn't regenerate.
If the enemy has destroyed your Power Plants, don't give up! This boost will temporarily solve the energy problem, protect the remaining buildings, and allow you to restore destroyed infrastructure.

SALE BONUS
Bonus from Major Pumpkin
SKIRMISH RULES
"General information

{#84}{#80}Co-op Skirmish[-] - competitive mode of the game where 2 players are fighting together against an AI-bot. They must achieve the highest possible score to win in the Co-op Skirmish stage. There is no clan score in Skirmish. Only a personal score is available.[-]

Leagues

{#84}Skirmish is designed similarly to Tournaments. All players are assigned to leagues based on their ranks. Each stage of a skirmish can last between a few days and a few weeks. Winners are determined and rewarded within each league at the end of a stage.[-]

Battles

{#84}2 players join the battle and fight against an AI bot. One player can call another one (from the same league and faction) at any moment by tapping the “call to battle” button on the player’s dashboard.

Unlike Tournaments, there is no limit to the number of battles within a single Skirmish stage. Each player can join the game up to three times per day. They can invite another player to a battle once, and they can be invited by other players twice.[-]

Winners

{#84}The current stage rating is based on the best personal results of each player. Winners within each league are determined at the end of a stage. They receive medals and rewards.[-]

Bot

{#84}The bot’s upgrade level and its difficulty are determined based on the highest rank in a pair of players.[-]

Chat

{#84}There is a chat to coordinate players’ actions within a skirmish battle. Try to cooperate with your partner as much as possible and act as a team. This way, you will be able to achieve the best possible results.[-]"
Do you want to open this case?
This skill has reached the maximum value for your rank

{#80}{#2599} air units.[-]
{#80}{#2599} buildings and dense clusters of units.[-]
{#80}{#2599} fast medium armored vehicles.[-]

Most effective against
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1064} {#673} 1[-]
{#2598}

Assault, an infantryman armed with an automatic rifle with an under barrel grenade launcher, mainly involved in battles with enemy infantry. Also, it is often used for reconnaissance operations and patrol."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1064} {#673} 2[-]
{#2597}

Heavy Assault is armed with an anti-tank rocket launcher and can cause great damage to hostile vehicles and buildings."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1064} {#673} 3[-]
{#2598}

Fire Assault is perfect for instant infantry annihilation. The short fire range is compensated for by a jumping engine, allowing him to quickly approach the target within shot distance. Fire Assaults are equipped with scanners that detect enemy infantrymen in the woods."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2669}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1065}[-]

Psionics can influence the consciousness of infantry and pilots, so they are able to take control of enemy units, as well as create panic in the enemy's ranks."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1066} {#673} 1[-]
{#2598}

A heavy assault infantry support vehicle, Fortress, is designed to destroy the enemy's manpower and light vehicles. It is armed with a machine gun and a flamethrower. Thanks to its heavy armor, Fortress serves as excellent cover for infantry and can withstand much fire itself. A mine detector allows it to find and neutralize enemy mines."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1066} {#673} 2[-]
{#2596}

Light tank Hammer has high speed and maneuverability, so it can perform various tasks from reconnaissance to storming a well-fortified base. A turret-based, 90mm armor-piercing gun allows it to deliver fire on the move with an insignificant loss of accuracy."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1066} {#673} 3[-]
{#2597}

Heavy assault tank Zeus is armed with a high-power thermoelectric gun and a missile launcher and can hit both ground and low-flying air targets. Heavy weight and low mobility are compensated with its impenetrable heavy armor and formidable destructive capabilities."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1067} {#673} 1[-]
{#2594}

Anti-aircraft vehicle Typhoon can detect and hit air targets both in march and stationary modes. The stationary mode increases Typhoon’s efficiency x2."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1067} {#673} 2[-]
{#2595}

Just one salvo of the MLRS Torrent covers a large area with massive intense fire. It can destroy an enemy army at long distances, staying out of fire range for hostile assault units. Torrent delivers fire only in siege mode. Low mobility and a long salvo preparation time make it defenseless in close combat."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1067} {#673} 3[-]

The Energy Shield combat support vehicle creates an energy field that enhances the armor of the nearby allied units. The field generator consumes a lot of energy, so the protective field can only be maintained for a short time. After that, the Shield needs time to recharge."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1068} {#673} 1[-]
{#2592}

The Cyclone light helicopter is armed with a machine gun. It is used mainly for intelligence operations and ground and marine unit support. The helicopter can be easily attacked by most ground units. Cyclone is provided with a submarine detection system."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1068} {#673} 2[-]
{#2591}

The Vertex fighter aircraft is provided with variable thrust vector jet engines that make it incredibly mobile. Its arsenal contains homing missiles capable of hitting both air and ground units with a fair degree of accuracy. However, weak armor makes the fighter an easy target for anti-aircraft warfare. Vertex has a limited fuel supply. When the fuel runs low, the fighter must return to the Airfield for refueling."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1068} {#673} 3[-]
{#2595}

A tactical bomber named Thor is protected with heavy aircraft armor that allows it to penetrate the heart of an enemy base and deliver a crushing blow to its infrastructure. Thor can drop bombs only once during one flight. Thor is based on an Airfield."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2674}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1070} {#673} 1[-]
{#2596}

The light assault amphibian Delta is armed with a medium-caliber autocannon. It fights effectively both on water and land. Thanks to their high mobility, Deltas can suddenly rush into the enemy base from the aquatic side, where no threat is even expected."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2674}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1070} {#673} 2[-]
{#2590}

The Viking destroyer is intended for the effective annihilation of a hostile fleet. It is armed with a three-barreled thermoelectric naval gun that is capable of breaching any armor and a Gauss torpedo launcher. An underwater detection system allows it to find and destroy enemy submarines."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2674}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1070} {#673} 3[-]
{#2597}

Poseidon, the heavy missile cruiser, is protected by a thick layer of naval armor, making it very slow and hulking. However, a long-range siege missile launcher allows it to attack land targets while remaining out of range of most ground units. An additional surface-to-air missile launcher protects this giant from air attacks."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1077} {#673} 1[-]
{#2592}

Cerberus is an elite assault forged in a heavy exoskeleton and armed with a unique multi-gun. He can fight effectively against both armored vehicles and infantry. His place is at the front lines. The jetpack allows Cerberus to instantly break into the enemy ranks, spreading chaos and panic. Also, it helps him to retreat quickly in a critical situation. The emergency energy shell amplifies his fighting survivability.

{#80}{#2471}[-]
{#40501}"
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1077} {#673} 2[-]
{#2597}

Seraphim is a unique transformer fighter that can move both in the air and on land. It can be used both along with the army and for solo sudden rear attacks on enemy bases. Seraphim is armed with powerful energy autocannons and the “Punishment” salvo missile system. Its power generators can increase weapon and engine abilities for a short period. It results in increasing the rate of fire and the hero's movement speed.

{#80}{#2471}[-]
{#40535}"
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1077} {#673} 3[-]
{#2595}

Solaris is a lethal combination of maneuverability and brute force. The energy weapon system ‘SPE-2.0’ releases a powerful stream of charged particles capable of penetrating any physical armor. It can fire in both impulse and strike modes. The power of the energy flow in the strike mode is comparable to the force of the flow on the solar surface.

{#80}{#2471}[-]
{#40562}"
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1094} {#673} 1[-]
{#2598}

Riflemen are the main infantry units of the Resistance army. Light infantry troops can secretly move through dense jungle and deliver sudden strikes against hostile infantry. Riflemen have individual combat rifles and electro-smoke grenades, which effectively decrease hostile units’ accuracy."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1094} {#673} 2[-]
{#2597}

Grenadiers are armed with individual grenade launchers. They cause great damage to hostile vehicles and buildings. Like Riflemen, they can hide in the jungle and ambush the enemy’s armored divisions and transport convoys."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2670}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1094} {#673} 3[-]
{#2598}

Snipers appear suddenly and shoot with deadly accuracy, giving enemies no chance of survival. Armed with the 12.7 mm advanced sniper rifle Cobra, experienced snipers can hit vulnerable spots in enemy armored units, even at maximum range. But don't leave them face-to-face with the enemy in a close battle."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2669}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1095}[-]

Saboteurs are specially trained soldiers of the rebellion. They are able to secretly infiltrate an enemy base and cause disruption."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1096} {#673} 1[-]
{#2598}

The ultra-light Coyote recon vehicle can move very fast, even off-road. This vehicle, armed with a light machine gun, is good for reconnaissance operations and rush attacks."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1096} {#673} 2[-]
{#2596}

The multipurpose combat vehicle Armadillo is armed with a rapid-firing auto-gun. Strong armor and high maneuverability make this vehicle suitable for any combat situation. Armadillo can also lay and find minefields.

{#80}{#1120}[-]
The universal mine triggers on all land units. Deals medium damage to any armor.

{#80}{#1121}[-]
The anti-personnel high-explosive mine triggers on infantry units only and deals a lot of damage to enemy infantry.

{#80}{#1122}[-]
The anti-tank mine triggers on ground vehicles only and deals a lot of damage to heavy armor."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2671}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1096} {#673} 3[-]
{#2597}

The heavy siege tank Jaguar is a combination of high mobility and devastating firepower. In march mode, it is a fast assault tank, capable of delivering fire while moving at high speed. In siege mode, the Jaguar's firepower doubles."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1097} {#673} 1[-]
{#2593}

The self-propelled anti-aircraft platform Porcupine is primarily intended to destroy air targets. Its panoramic missile launcher can lock and hit targets at a moment's notice, and its paired, triple-barreled machine gun can fire at both air and ground targets."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1097} {#673} 2[-]
{#2595}

Self-propelled artillery, Mammoth, can fire only in siege mode. Its howitzer weapon has a great firing range, allowing you to surprise the enemy with a well-planned artillery attack. But in close combat, the slow Mammoth becomes an easy target."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1097} {#673} 3[-]

The Chameleon’s active camouflage system can generate an ionized fog bank where allied units can hide. Enemy electronics can’t detect the hidden units. The enemy sees an approaching cloud and can only fire at will. The only way they can discover the hidden units is to send a scout into the cloud."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1098} {#673} 1[-]
{#2592}

The Dragonfly light attack helicopter is armed with a machine gun and guided missiles. It is perfect for both recon operations and sudden airstrikes."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1098} {#673} 2[-]
{#2591}

The 5th generation heavy fighter Hawk is good against both ground and air targets. But in air combat, it’s disadvantaged compared to its Confederation counterpart because of its heavy weight and lower mobility. When the aircraft is low on fuel, it must be refueled at an Airfield. The fighter’s armor is not forceful, so it must avoid air defense systems."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1098} {#673} 3[-]
{#2595}

The Albatross tactical bomber is an indestructible air fortress that can survive multiple anti-air missile hits. Targets may be bombed even in the center of a heavily protected enemy base. This aircraft can make only one bomb run per flight. Albatross is based at an Airfield."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2674}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1100} {#673} 1[-]
{#2592}

A light recon boat, Caiman, serves for fast naval operations. Its machine gun can’t cause serious damage to heavily armored ships. But on the other hand, Caiman’s high speed becomes its main asset in different situations. It can also lay down and find naval mines.

{#80}{#1123}[-]
A naval mine explodes any naval unit and causes great damage to both heavy and medium armor."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2674}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1100} {#673} 2[-]
{#2590}

A heavy corvette, Alligator, is armed with a double-barreled naval gun and an air-defense missile launcher. Despite the heavy armor, the Alligator remains the most maneuverable ship of its kind."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2674}[-]
{#80}{#2668}[-] {#81}{#1100} {#673} 3[-]
{#2590}

The Barracuda submarine is equipped with a vertical launch missile system. It can appear suddenly along the coast of an enemy base and destroy it in a few minutes. The submarine can launch torpedoes, which makes it a dangerous enemy for the entire Confederation fleet. When submerged, the Barracuda is invisible to most units but can be spotted by the Viking destroyer, Cyclone helicopter, or enemy Torpedo Platform."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1107} {#673} 1[-]
{#2598}

“Wasp” light helicopter is aimed at providing fire support to the storming squads. Wasp alone doesn't pose a serious threat. However, as a support unit, it may significantly increase the firepower of the army. Its Acid Burst deals massive damage to all units and greatly decreases their armor. Also, light toxic missiles deal increased damage to the enemy's light-armored troops. To provide maximum agility, Wasp has almost no armor. But in battle, it may cover itself and allied helicopters with a Mist Disguise to raise the survivability.

{#80}{#2471}[-]
{#40595}"
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2672}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1107} {#673} 2[-]
{#2589}

The ""Mole"" engineering machine is aimed at supporting ground units and holding strategic points in war zones. A massive drill is not only a threatening weapon. Along with the auger chassis, it allows Mole to quickly dig in and transform itself into a mobile workshop. In emergency cases, Mole can completely go underground. Mole can deploy turrets that automatically attack land and low-flying targets.

{#80}{#2471}[-]
{#40623}"
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2673}[-]
{#80}{#2667}[-] {#81}{#1107} {#673} 3[-]
{#2595}

Leviathan is a flying fortress armed with two frontal and two side twin autocannons. Apart from heavy armor, this giant is equipped with significant defensive weaponry. The air defense system allows it to effectively resist aviation, and the anti-missile system distracts a part of the enemy's missiles thanks to automatic thermal traps. However, the main and the most dangerous weapon of the air cruiser is tactical nuclear missiles that can turn the entire army to ashes.

{#80}{#2471}[-]
{#40655}"
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2675}[-]

Headquarters is responsible for battle management. The command center is situated there. Heavy armor provides safe protection for the command, while a built-in reserve generator and resource supply unit make it independent. The Headquarters has communication lines with higher command and everything necessary to control units on the battlefield. The maximum number of Command Points (CP) you can have depends on the Headquarters' level. Upgrading the Headquarters in the battle allows you to have a more powerful army under your control and allows you to build and upgrade other high-level buildings."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2675}[-]

A Power Plant produces energy. It is needed for all other buildings to operate. If there is a shortage of energy for any building, it stops working until the power supply is restored. Energy is delivered first to Construction Yards, and then to all other buildings."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2675}[-]

A Supply Center provides resources. Due to logistical problems, every new Supply Center on the battlefield provides fewer resources than the previous one."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2675}[-]

A Construction Yard is needed to build, upgrade, and repair buildings on a battlefield. Every building can be built only within the construction area of a Construction Yard. Damaged buildings in this area are repaired automatically."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

Infantry units are trained in Barracks. Upgrade the Barracks on a battlefield to get access to new types of infantry units."

"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

An Assault Vehicle Factory produces armored assault vehicles to fight against enemy units and fortifications in a close battle."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

A Special Vehicle Factory produces special battle vehicles used for the protection and support of assault vehicles and infantry units on the battlefield."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

An Avia Factory produces helicopters and warplanes. You must have at least one landing place at an Airfield to begin warplane production."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

Warplanes are based on an Airfield. They are repaired and refueled there."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

A Shipyard produces naval units. It can be set only on the water."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

A Space system allows you to deal a devastating blow to any point through orbiting satellites. The energy is accumulated in special storage and then transmitted to a reflecting satellite, which redirects it to the target point on Earth. One space strike requires a great amount of energy, resources, and time for all systems to be prepared, but the damage is equal to a nuclear explosion."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2678}[-]

The Wall is the simplest defense construction used to block the way of enemy ground units."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2598}

A Bunker is an armored defensive building, best against hostile infantry and light vehicles. Its heavy armor allows it to hold off even heavy vehicles for a short time."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2589}

A Rocket Tower is designed to destroy enemy ground vehicles and infantry at long range."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2594}

A Stationary Air Defense system is designed to destroy enemy aviation effectively at long range."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2588}

A Torpedo Platform is a multifunctional naval defense system. It is equipped with sonar and can detect enemy submarines. Its main armament is a torpedo launcher. It also has an Air Defense system to guard against airstrikes from the sea."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-] 
 
A classified factory combined with a research center. It concentrates all the technology needed to produce combat prototypes — Heroes."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

The elite soldiers of the Resistance can be trained in Saboteur school."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

A Nuclear Launcher is designed for nuclear missile preparation and launch. One launch requires plenty of resources and preparation time. But a successful nuclear strike can decide the whole battle."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2598}

A Sniper Tower is a reliable facility to control and protect the base perimeter. The sniper in the tower has a great sight range. He can fire at approaching hostile units immediately."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2589}

A large-caliber Gun Tower is very effective against heavily armored enemy vehicles. Its short firing range is compensated for by its tremendous firepower."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2677}[-]
{#2588}

A Naval Platform with an automatic, quick-firing anti-aircraft gun provides naval and air defense. Initially, it was designed to protect against ships and has a torpedo launcher with a water target detection system."
"{#84}{#80}{#2679}[-] {#81}{#2676}[-]

A secret factory that produces special experimental units — Heroes. All advanced technologies of the Resistance are implemented here."
"{#0}{#0}{#80}Available in PvP from rank:[-] {#81}{0}[-]
{#84}Until then, it can only be used in campaign missions."

The number on the button shows {#86}the number of units[-] ready to perform this command.
Select units with a rectangle
"Tap this button and {#86}drag a rectangle[-]. The selected units {#86}will be highlighted[-].

You can also activate the rectangle selection mode by {#86}a long tap[-] in any cell."
Select units with an outline
Tap this button and {#86}draw a line[-] around the units you want to select. The units inside the outline {#86}will be selected[-].
{#86}Reset[-] selection or {#86}cancel[-]
"If you have one or more units selected, press this button to {#86}reset the selection[-].
In other cases, this button acts as {#86}""Cancel""[-]."
{#86}Cancel[-] the current unit action
"This button {#86}cancels[-] the current action of the selected units.

If the unit is in {#86}siege mode[-], the button {#86}will not transfer[-] it to march mode.

If a unit {#86}is attacking[-] another unit, the cancellation {#86}may not show[-] a visible result, because the unit halts that attack and immediately seeks a new target to attack."
Patrol
To send the selected units {#86}to patrol an area[-], tap this button, and then {#86}specify two points[-]. The area between them will be patrolled.
Hold position
The command {#80}"hold position"[-] makes the selected units {#86}stand still[-] and fire only at targets within the firing range. Units {#86}won't move[-], even if they are under enemy fire. This command can be canceled by any other command.
Quick upgrade button
"{#86}All buildings ready to be upgraded[-] are here.

The building icon indicates its {#80}level[-] and the amount of {#89}resources[-] required to upgrade it.

A tap on the building {#86}will start its upgrade automatically[-]."
Switch to siege mode
"This command switches the selected units into {#86}siege mode[-]. To move units, you need to switch them back to march mode.

Units that can attack the enemy {#86}only in siege mode[-] can be switched to siege mode just by giving them {#86}an Attack or Ground Attack[-] command.

{#3000}"
Switch to march mode.
"This command switches the selected units back into {#86}march mode[-].

{#3000}"
Ground Attack
"Units with {#86}heavy weapons[-] can launch a ground attack even when the aim is {#86}out of sight[-]. Tap the button and specify a point of attack. Acceptable {#86}fire zones[-] will be shown for units in siege mode and heavy naval units. When specifying the point, the approximate zone of the {#86}projectile deployment[-] will be indicated. The further the point from the unit is, the greater the projectiles' dispersal area will be. This command is canceled by any other command.

{#3000}"
Bombard
"This command can be given to {#86}bombers[-] ready for a flight. Click the button and {#86}drag the arrow[-] to show the direction and the angle of the trajectory. You'll see {#86}the approximate[-] points of bomb release at the arrows. The longer an arrow is, the longer the approach to the target is. Bombers will set out as soon as you confirm the command. They are ready to perform a task only if they are {#86}fully fueled[-].

{#3000}"
Activate a protective field
"Activates a protective field of {#80}an Energy Shield[-]. The activation requires {#86}energy[-]. When the energy is gone, the protective field will be deactivated automatically.

{#3000}"
Deactivate a protective field
"Deactivates a protective field of {#80}an Energy Shield[-]. In order to {#86}save energy[-], you can {#86}stop using[-] the protective field.

{#3000}"
Activate a fog generator
"Activates {#80}a Chameleon[-] fog generator. The activation requires energy. When {#86}the energy[-] is gone, the fog generator will be deactivated automatically.

{#3000}"
Deactivate a fog generator
"Deactivates {#80}the Chameleon[-] fog generator. You can {#86}stop using[-] the fog generator {#86}to save energy[-].

{#3000}"
Mine the territory
"{#80}The Armadillo[-] combat vehicle and {#80}the Caiman[-] light boat can {#86}mine territories[-]. To give the selected units the command to mine a territory, you should click the button, select a mine type, and set the cells where the mines are to be placed. {#86}The total cost[-] of mine setting will be posted on a confirmation button. After confirmation, the selected {#80}Armadillos or Caimans[-] will mine territories.

{#3000}"
Demine a territory
"{#80}The Fortress[-] assault machine and {#80}the Delta[-] amphibian can {#86}locate and clear mines[-]. To start demining, give the command and {#86}show the set point[-]. Units will go there in mine search mode and demine all the mines found.

{#3000}"
Scramble the fighters
"The command launches the selected fighters for {#86}base's defense[-]. The scrambled fighters circle the base and attack detected enemy units. If no targets are found, the fighters return to the Airfield.

{#3000}"
Relocate warplanes
The command is for {#86}relocating[-] selected warplanes to another Airfield. To give this command, click the button and set the Airfield for relocation.
Hide in the forest
A command to selected infantry to move stealthily into the forest. In this mode, the infantry hidden in the woods does not respond to any enemy units or fire until detected or the command is canceled. A unit hidden in a forest can be detected by an enemy unit located in the neighboring cell.
Cease hiding in the forest
Cancels the stealth movement in the forest for all selected infantrymen.
Construction
Here, you can choose {#86}a building to be constructed[-]. The {#89}resources[-] needed and {#91}the energy[-] consumption are shown on the icon of the building. Choose the building and place it on the map in the construction area. Buildings can't stand {#86}back to back[-]. The building can {#86}be rotated[-] while being located on the map. The cell where the building's exit is located is marked with an arrow. Confirm the location of the building to begin construction.
Use a boost
"Choose a boost from the list and use it. Its {#86}time duration[-] with the {#86}accumulated bonus[-] is on the boost icon.

{#2069}"
Minimap
On the minimap, you can see {#86}both your enemy's and your own objects[-]. They have {#86}the same color as the player[-]. Significant events are also shown on the minimap. {#86}Tap the minimap[-] to move the camera quickly to any point on the map.
Resources
"Here are your {#89}resources[-]. They are needed for {#86}building[-] construction and unit {#86}training[-]. {#80}Supply Centers[-] deliver resources to the battlefield. Resource delivery from several Supply Centers (SC) {#86}is summarized[-], but due to the logistical difficulties, every consecutive SC gives you {#86}fewer[-] resources than the previous one. Additionally, {#80}Headquarters[-] also produces a few resources.

You can also get additional resources if you {#86}obtain the containers[-], which are spread across the battlefield. If you want to get them, you should send any ground or water unit to the indicated zone."
Energy
"Here is shown the production and consumption of {#91}energy[-]. It's needed for buildings {#86}operating[-]. If a building lacks energy, it {#86}stops[-] working. There will be an icon above it that indicates a lack of energy. Energy {#86}is not accumulated[-] but is used immediately by the buildings that consume it. The energy production of several Power Plants {#86}is summarized[-]. 

A small additional amount of energy is produced by {#80}Headquarters[-]. It completely provides energy to itself and at least one {#80}Construction Yard[-].

At first, the energy goes to {#80}the Construction Yards[-]. Other buildings are plugged into the power supply network {#86}in the order of construction[-]. Therefore, if there is an energy shortage, the first buildings to be switched off are those that were constructed last."
Command Points
"Command Points (CP) determine the maximum number of units under your command on a battlefield. Every unit needs a number of Command Points displayed on the unit icon. The amount of available CP depends on the Headquarters level. CP from several HQs are not summarized.

If your army reaches the maximum number of CP, new units won't be produced until you upgrade your Headquarters to the next level or until you lose some units on a battlefield. This limit does not affect incoming troop reinforcements."
Groups
"These are the control buttons for {#86}groups of units[-]. You can {#86}save[-] the selected units to a group so that you can quickly {#86}select[-] the group and {#86}move the camera[-] to it. 

To save the selected units to a group, {#86}tap[-] the empty group button. The group will be saved to the selected button, and the unit icon along with {#86}the number[-] of units in the group will be displayed on the button. If you want to save the group to an already {#86}occupied button[-], you can use {#86}a long tap[-] on the occupied button. The new group {#86}will be set[-] on the selected button.

Tap the button {#86}to highlight[-] the group. A double-tap {#86}will transfer the camera[-] to the center of the group."
Space strike
The targeting system is ready for the launch of a Space strike. Click the button and set a cell for the strike.
Nuclear missile
A Nuclear missile is ready to be launched. Tap the button and set a cell for a strike.
Add the units to the already selected ones
Tap this button and select units by any means available. These units will be added to those that have already been selected.
Battle chat
You may send a brief message to your ally. Some messages require a location to be indicated on the map. Coordinate your actions with your ally to achieve maximum efficiency.
Observation
Puts the selected units in observation mode. In this mode, they do not open fire on enemy units or buildings. You can cancel the mode by pressing the "Cancel" button or by specifying a target for attack.
"{#3066}

In this mode, Resistance infantry doesn't reveal itself in the forest."
Cancel observation
Cancels the observation mode for the selected units
Move at the same speed
Commands the selected units to move at speed as the slowest unit of the group.
Take positions
This command allows you to place the selected units at specified points.
Select all units
Tap this button to select {#86}all units[-] on the map.

"Units ordered via {#86}the quick order bar[-] will be added to {#86}the queue[-] in the free producing buildings.

"To send the selected units to patrol an area, tap this button, and then set two points.

The first and the last points are set by a short tap. For additional route points, a long tap is used. 

To set a circular route, set the last point to the beginning of the route. 

In the patrol mode, units move by the set points in assault mode. When they meet an enemy, they engage in battle. After an enemy is destroyed, they get back to their route."
Tap this button to select all units on the map. In the settings menu, you can disable the selection of some unit types.
{#0}{#0}Use a long tap to set additional route points. Short tap — set up the last rally point.

fr=0;lvl=1;txt=At the beginning of the battle, send scout units to collect resource containers. The collected resources will help you build a base and prepare for battle much faster. The more containers you collect, the greater your advantage over the enemy.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=At the beginning of the battle, send infantry to scout the territory. It allows you to find resource containers and learn more about enemy tactics.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=Build more Supply Centers. Proper investment of resources early in the battle will allow you to develop more effectively in the future.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=Confederation Assaults are most effective against infantry and Heavy Assaults against armored vehicles and buildings.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=Resistance Riflemen are most effective against infantry. Grenadiers are more effective against armored vehicles and buildings. All Resistance infantry units can hide in a forest.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Fortresses have heavy armor, but their armament is mainly effective against infantry. It's not a good idea to use them against enemy armored vehicles.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Coyotes are very fast but weakly armored. Their high maneuverability allows them to avoid Heavy Assault rockets. They are most effective against infantry.
fr=1;lvl=3;txt=The most effective units against Coyote rush attacks are Hammers. They are fast, maneuverable, and can deliver aimed fire at moving targets. Use them together with Fortresses that can take heavy fire upon themselves.
fr=2;lvl=3;txt=The most effective units against Fortress rush attacks are Armadillos. They have strong armor, high speed, and can cause a lot of damage to armored targets. Use them with Coyotes, which are capable of driving around rapidly and breaking up enemy formations.
fr=1;lvl=4;txt=The impact of minefields on your infantry and vehicles can be significant. Use Fortresses to find and deactivate enemy mines.
fr=2;lvl=4;txt=The Armadillo can lay minefields. Mine the approaches to the base to weaken the enemy's attack.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=Double tapping on a free cell allows you to select all units on the screen. A double tap on a unit selects all the units of the same type on the screen.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=If fewer than 3 minutes remain until the upgrade is complete, you can speed it up for free. It allows you to save time on upgrades.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=Most values on the interface dashboards have tips. Just tap on an unclear value to receive a tip.
fr=0;lvl=2;txt=The HQ gives Command Points (CP) needed to command units. Each unit demands a certain number of CP. Upgrade the HQ during the battle to get more CP.
fr=0;lvl=2;txt=One tap will send the selected units to the point. In this case, they will fire on the move if they meet any enemies.
fr=0;lvl=2;txt=A double tap will send the selected units to the point in assault mode. In this case, they will stop and attack any hostile units they meet. They will continue to move to the point after they destroy all enemies met.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Perform upgrades to the Supply Center to increase resource income in battle. The higher your resource income, the higher your chance of winning.
fr=0;lvl=4;txt=If your HQ and Construction Yard are destroyed, don't give up! You can build a new HQ in the initial position.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Real men do not surrender in the face of difficulty and failure! In war, you must accept defeat appropriately and learn from your mistakes. Every defeat makes you stronger. Every defeat is another step towards your future victories.
fr=0;lvl=2;txt=A long tap on any item on the battle interface will show you a detailed hint. Examine all the buttons and learn helpful information about unit control.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=War is not just victories and triumphs. Accept your defeats with courage, analyze your mistakes to improve tactics, and become stronger with each failure. The only way to become a superb commander is to do this.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=The resource containers are scattered over battle maps. Collect them at the beginning of the battle to get more resources. To pick up a container, move any ground unit close to it.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=On many maps, the resource containers are scattered not only on land but also at sea. They can be collected with any marine unit. Build a Shipyard as soon as possible, so you will be able to collect the containers before your opponent. Additional resources will provide you with a significant advantage in development.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Boosts give you a tactical advantage in battle. A properly applied boost can radically change the situation and carry you closer to victory.
fr=0;lvl=4;txt=Boosts do not guarantee you a victory. They only provide a significant advantage in the hands of a competent commander. Use boosts wisely, and victory will be yours.
fr=0;lvl=5;txt=Using boosts is critical for winning, as well as upgrading units and buildings. If you don't use boosts, you reduce your chances of victory. Perhaps your opponent is already increasing the income of resources with a boost.
fr=0;lvl=5;txt=Spend a part of your credits to purchase boosts. They allow you to win more often and earn more credits.
fr=0;lvl=4;txt=Join a clan. There, you will find like-minded friends who will help you understand the game better and teach you new winning tactics. It also allows you to earn more credits for participating in Tournaments.
fr=0;lvl=4;txt=Do not try to join the best clan immediately. The top clans do not accept rookies. Choose a clan suitable for you based on your rank. To do this, look at the clan's list of players.
fr=0;lvl=7;txt=To join a good clan, keep your win rate (percentage of victories in PvP) at a high level. Don't hesitate to communicate with the leader of the clan. He is a player, just like you.
fr=0;lvl=1;txt=To get access to new units and buildings, perform the task from the Command and Campaign missions.
fr=0;lvl=2;txt=Each unit has its own features, strengths, and weaknesses. Study them and use the units according to their specialties. This is a crucial aspect of achieving success in a battle.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Improve your units and buildings between battles. Although the increase of every single characteristic may seem insignificant, it will give you a huge overall advantage in battle.
fr=0;lvl=4;txt=Don't be afraid to experiment and make unusual decisions in battle. This may confuse the enemy and give you a tactical advantage.
fr=1;lvl=4;txt=Resistance Infantry can hide in the forests and observe your actions. Use Fire Assaults or Cyclone helicopters to detect and destroy hidden enemy observers.
fr=2;lvl=4;txt=One of the advantages of the Resistance is stealth ability. All infantry units can hide in the forest and observe the actions of the enemy. Use this to learn about your opponent's plans and take countermeasures in advance. Fire Assaults and helicopters can detect hidden infantry.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=A clever commander knows all the strengths and weaknesses of the opponent. Complete campaigns for both factions to study your enemy in depth. In addition, it will give you extra golden credits.
fr=0;lvl=4;txt=The result of a battle depends on your ability to make the right decisions. You can even win against a stronger opponent if you make the right tactical and strategic decisions.
fr=0;lvl=3;txt=Use the "Infantry Scouting" boost at the beginning of the battle to explore the map and collect resource containers quicker than your enemy. This will increase your chances of winning.
fr=0;lvl=6;txt=In the heat of battle, don't forget to charge your device's battery. This will save you from a technical defeat.
fr=0;lvl=5;txt=Don't waste a single second during Deployment! Build a Barracks and Assault Vehicle Factory as quickly as possible and start producing units for reconnaissance, container collection, and base protection.
fr=0;lvl=7;txt=The artillery is effective from a distance but very vulnerable in close combat. Always take care to protect it from enemy assault units.
























































• Random key objects causing various effects are located on the map.
• Capture flags to get objects' effects.
• To see an object's effect, tap on the adjacent flag.
• {#3427}
• No walls are allowed to be built.
• Capture pumpkins to win.
• {#3270} 
• Construction is only possible on high ground.
• There are warehouses on the map. Destroy them to get extra pumpkins.
• There are warehouses on the map. Destroy them to get extra Christmas trees.





На заводах производятся транспортники, которые направляются к базам игроков.


Эвакуируйте 20 транспортников.
30 секунд до появления транспортников.
Транспортники появились









Cryotech Plant
"The Syndicate has revealed the location of the Cryotech Plant. This plant produces cryocapsules and is under enemy control. Each cryocapsule is priceless in this summer heat, so seize the plant to secure this crucial resource!

{#80}• {#5260}[-]

{#83}{#639}:[-]
{#7667}
{#7668}
{#7669}
{#7670}"

Boiling Waters
"The sun is mercilessly scorching. The fighters are going mad from the heat, and the navigation instruments are failing. Even the water in the bay has heated up to the point where the fish are cooking alive. The command is dropping cryocapsules onto the battlefield to keep the army combat-ready. Collect the cryocapsules and defeat the enemy in the fierce battle!


{#80}• {#3150}[-]

Initial appointment
Captain! You are being sent to Fort Kyten in South America immediately. The region has experienced increased Resistance activity. We are preparing for a worst-case scenario. Report to Colonel Rice when you get there.
We were preparing to suppress the uprising, but we did not expect the rebels to begin such a large-scale war so soon. You will act under Colonel Rice's command and help bring order to the region. We must nip the uprising in the bud!
{#5999<01>}
The World on Fire
The world is on fire, and we are in the thick of it! Every minute, from all corners of the world, come reports of new outbreaks of rebellion. The rebels have demanded that the Senate be dissolved and the Old World Order be restored. But we do not intend to make concessions. The rebellion must be suppressed by any means! The command has high hopes for you. The fate of the entire South American region now depends on your actions.

Complete 3 tasks
Scientific Approach
Good afternoon, Commander! I'm Dr. Camilius. I have been instructed to assist you in modernizing military equipment and vehicles. Furthermore, I don't like unnecessary conversation, so let's just get to the point. The assault soft suit is only suitable for dispersing street demonstrations. It’s time-critical to undertake work on its modernization. A bit of time and funding will be needed for this.

{#5998<Battle Suit><Assault>}
Help is Coming
We're keeping in touch with Fort Avis. The rebels have hurt them a lot! A reinforcement column is being sent from the south to the fort, but it is unlikely to come on time. Following the previous onslaught, the fort is unlikely to stand. We must help our neighbors. You will lead a support team and go to the defense of Fort Avis. Take Action!

{#5999<02>}
Brilliant Result

The air raids on our positions have become more frequent. The Resistance increasingly resorts to heavy aircraft. We must redouble our efforts for the protection of our airspace! The improved Typhoons are ideal to protect ground troops from the threat from the air.

{#5988<6><Typhoon>}
Escape with Luggage
Our sudden landing in the south allows you to quickly and easily approach the rebels' rear base, which supplies all of their advanced outposts. The enemy will try to take out the supplies. Don't let the caravans go into the desert.

{#5999<36>}
Cornerstone
Infantry is the cornerstone of any military operation. As the conflict has dragged on, our infantry has become exhausted and depressed. The only thing we can do now is improve the conditions for their deployment and training. Upgrade the Barracks to improve the efficiency of infantry training.

{#5988<6><Barracks>}
Full Blockade
Following the destruction of their supply base, the rebels can still deliver resources through the port base in the Western Sahara. This cannot be allowed to happen. We'll use a heavy fleet and block the retreat of the enemy.

{#5999<37>}




Legendary Fleet
For your services, Command is permitting you to use a heavy fleet. I am instructed to prepare the production of Poseidon cruisers. Firstly, we need to upgrade the Shipyard.

{#5995<Shipyard><3>}
Urgent Inspection
We have established an exact point for enemy arms transfers. Our reconnaissance teams have recorded increased activity in this area. But there was nothing in the bay more dangerous than light boats. I have ordered patrols to inspect the bay area again. If any threats are discovered, we will have the means to deal with them.

{#5999<38>}
Lord of the Sea
The heavy fleet was always the pride of the Confederation. The “Poseidon” is a strong ship. But there is no limit to perfection. To keep our advantage on the sea, our warships must be equipped with the latest technology. Start upgrading Poseidon with its primary weapon, the “Squall” tactical rocket.

{#5998<Tactical Rocket><Poseidon>}
Storming the Fortress
The military base in Niger is the last stronghold of the Resistance in West Africa. It has been reported that large numbers of reinforcements are being sent from the neighboring region. The rebels are planning to counterattack. We must not allow that to happen. The Command is pulling together all available forces to storm this base. You will command the assault.

{#5999<39>}
God of War
Rebels actively experiment with various types of armor, and, I must say, not without results. It's time to seriously work on upgrading the Zeus to improve its excellence. Any armor must be penetrated!

{#5988<6><Zeus>}
The Libyan Incident
Due to a bureaucratic error, nuclear weapon silos in Libya were not destroyed during the world disarmament. While you were fighting in Niger, the rebels broke through and took possession of these objects. Return control so the unavoidable doesn't happen.

{#5999<40>}
Down to the Foundation
The MLRS Torrent is equally effective in the destruction of both units and fortifications. But Resistance technology is constantly improving armor, vehicles, and buildings. Upgrade the Torrent to retain the advantage in this constant technological race.

{#5988<6><Torrent>}
Base in Tobruk
The rebel base in Tobruk was of no previous interest. Only a few repair Shipyards were located there. But now that nuclear warheads have fallen into the rebels' hands, priorities have changed. If there is even the slightest chance that warheads will be installed on submarines, we must stop it.

{#5999<41>}
Military Engineering
The active use of assault vehicles has forced production to move closer to the front line. Such proximity places it in danger of rebel attacks but allows for a faster supply of new vehicles to the front. Improve factories to increase their security and production efficiency.

{#5988<6><Assault Vehicle Factory>}
The Suez Canal
The Resistance Navy “leaked” into the Mediterranean Sea through the Suez Canal. In the course of the ground operations, we managed to regain control of the channel. But the rebels must now go on the assault because, with the loss of the channel, they will completely lose all of the Mediterranean Sea.

{#5999<42>}
Scorched Earth
When attacking our fortifications, the rebels rely on numerical superiority. But we have a proven tool— a Rocket Tower. Invest in its upgrades, and the enemy will be reduced to only smoke and ash.

{#5988<6><Rocket Tower>}
Ahead
The Resistance is experiencing a gigantic shortage of forces in the region. Our intelligence has received information about their impending reinforcements on the East Coast. The rebels have decided to take a chance and break through to their regional forces, right under our noses. Intercept the enemy's detachments so that no one penetrates deep into the region.

{#5999<43>}
Big Deal
In the course of military operations in Africa, documents containing the names and call signs of rebel commanders were found. The enemy's network was much wider than expected. In a separate order, Headquarters calls on all officers to eliminate these threats.

{#5993<300>}
Bloodhounds
Residual radiation was found near the Resistance's base in Sudan. It is believed that the warheads left the region from this location. Vehicles with special apparatus have been transferred to the nearest base. Go to the site immediately and conduct a thorough review.

{#5999<44>}
Iron Supremacy
Our equipment is much superior to the Resistance junk. But the rebels are not sitting idle and are actively rearming their army. With our capabilities, we must always keep one step ahead. Perform a complete upgrade of all assault vehicles.

{#5988<30><Assault vehicles>}
Looking for a Trace
The special forces unit is ready to go on the trail of the stolen warheads. In this region, the rebels rule unchecked, and we will have to fight our way out. You must escort the detachment to your destination and repel the rebels.

{#5999<45>}
Important Role
The Resistance fleet has increasingly heavier combat units. Corvettes and submarines pose a real threat and can break the Torpedo Platform line of defense. For this to happen, we need to upgrade the platforms.

{#5988<6><Torpedo Platform>}
There are Leads
A small village in the jungle has attracted the attention of our specialists. Intelligence reports indicate that there is a warehouse or a transshipment point nearby. The defense at the site is three times that of a standard garrison. Find out what the rebels are storing there.

{#5999<46>}
Inspection
After examining the movement of ships along that stretch of Africa, analysts have calculated a probable transit hub location. Interrupt the deliveries and find out where the goods are shipped to on land.

{#5999<47>}
The New Generation
For a long time, the “Vertex” fighter was ahead of its time in combat performance. This is due to the large amount of research invested in its development. To stay head and shoulders above the enemy, continue to improve the fighter.

{#5988<6><Vertex>}
Test Site
The Resistance base in the desert appears very similar to a test site: a nuclear launcher, numerous soldiers, and technicians. We believe that the destruction of silos will disrupt the plans of the rebels. But be careful! We don't know the exact fate of the warheads.

{#5999<48>}
Space Program
The space program has begun. Only a few days remain until full readiness. The Command has created a list of officers for admission to the program, and I have proposed your candidacy. But to be approved, several conditions have to be met.

Finish 3 Special Tasks
Construction of the Century
The Command has declared a red danger level. The Senate supports the use of a Space Strike to prevent a nuclear threat. This will be the first combat use of the new weapon. Construction of a prototype Space System has begun. After this, the advantage will be on our side.

{#5999<49>}
Higher Rank (Special)
Gaining access to the Space System is not easy. All those below the rank of Commander are dismissed immediately. You should step up and seek promotion to that rank. Then you will have a better chance of gaining admission.

Get Grade I Commander rank
Only the Best (Special)
Only the best officers will be granted access to the program. If you have special merits, then present them! And, if you have nothing to show, then I will be against your admission! Even the support of the Minister will not help you here.

Win 20 Victories in the Tournament Battles
Dry Statistics (Special)
The Command conducts a rigid selection of candidates based on many parameters. But special attention is paid to the execution of Contracts. You still have time to prepare.

Execute 20 Contracts
The Last Point
Our satellites have detected several missile launches from Madagascar. The rebels' weapons cannot cover a great distance but already pose a real threat. Our fleet has blockaded the island, ground units have begun to land, and the Space System is ready to be tested in combat conditions. It's time to put an end to this matter.

{#5999<50>}

All conditions have been met! The Command is providing you with access to the Space Program. This includes drawings of the Space System and the keys to access the satellite system. Open the Space Program to be able to launch a Space Strike.

Our Assaults are struggling to contain enemy forces. Several improvements need to be made to increase their effectiveness in combat.

CmP
If several players have an identical amount of CmP in the league, the player who got the points earlier wins.
If various teams have the same score in the league, the team that gets the score first wins.

Blitz

Number of victories
{#2210}
Access to VIP Rewards
In Competition rewards: Tournaments, Skirmishes, Blitz Tournaments
{#84}{#80}Tournament[-] is a competition to determine the strongest players. A tournament may take from several days to several weeks. Competition battles may have particular winning conditions. When the tournament ends, the best players in the rating get prizes.
{#84}Tournament battles are scheduled. You may apply to play 5 minutes before a battle begins. Enable notifications to avoid forgetting to join the battle.
{#84}{#80}Skirmish[-] is a competition involving players competing together in a team battle against an AI bot. Skirmish may last from several days to several weeks. Competition battles may have particular winning conditions. When Skirmish ends, the best players in the rating get prizes.
{#84}You can only join Skirmish battles as a team.
{#84}The difficulty of the AI bot and its upgrade levels are determined by the rank of the strongest player in a team.
Joining Battle
{#84}To join a team battle, you can apply for it using the Skirmish screen or challenge a player from your friend, clan, or rating list.
{#84}You can only join a battle with a player of your league and faction.
{#84}In team battles, there is a chat to coordinate players' actions. Teamwork and cooperation are the keys to victory.
Competition Points, Rating, and Leagues
{#84}Victories in competition battles complete the progress and unlock rewards.
"{#84}The total {#80}score[-] of the competition gets into the {#80}rating[-]. Each competition has its specific rules regarding score and rating.
The best players in the rating get valuable prizes."
{#84}Players compete against each other within {#80}leagues[-]. Each league has its player rating and winners. If a player's league increases during the competition, the player finishes the competition in the league in which they started.
Stages
{#84}The competition may include several {#80}stages[-]
"{#84}During the Training Stage:
 {#80}•[-] Battles require no Permits;
 {#80}•[-] Battle rewards are reduced;
 {#80}•[-] Battle results aren't counted.
Some competitions have no Training Stage."
{#84}During the Main Stage, battles respect the competition rules. The number of battles in a competition may be limited.
{#84}During the Final Stage, the results are summarized. Players get rewards for being among the best.
"{#84}Credits[-] and {#80}Permits[-] are required to join a battle. 
The entry cost (in Permits) increases after each battle during the day for each competition separately. The next day, the cost is reset to its initial value. 

 {#80}•[-] To join a {#80}team battle[-], all players should have enough credits and Permits."
{#84}Permits have a limit. Permits don't accumulate in excess of the limit.
Permits available:
Offers
COMPETITION RERUN
{#84}The Competition rerun allows you to improve your score in the competition rating and complete your reward progress.
"{#84}Rerun resets the counter of battles played to 0. Retained: 

 {#80}•[-] Reward progress made;
 {#80}•[-] Previously unlocked access to VIP Rewards;
 {#80}•[-] Best score in the rating."
{#84}Even if the score of a new try is worse, the best score of previous tries will get into the rating.
The player can't accept your challenge now.
To select battle types, buy {#81}{#1440}[-].

Strategic stockpile

• Defend your control point from the pirates. If they capture the control point, you will lose part of your strategic stockpile.
• The one whose progress bar empties faster shall lose.

"The arena is burning with a fierce battle for control points. Experienced commanders are ready to clash in a deadly fight where it's every man for himself. Victory depends on seizing checkpoints scattered across the battlefield. Each checkpoint captured earns players between one and three points. Weakest Link
"Several commanders are fighting to control the area. All of them have the same starting positions, but the number of flags is limited. Capture and control the flags to steal Control Points from your enemies. Losing all Control Points leads to a defeat, so you won't be able to sit back at the base. Fight for each flag and prove to your enemies that you are not the weakest link!

• Losing all the Control Points makes you defeated.

• To win, complete the progress bar in full.

Conversion
Convert


Not enough cards to convert
You can convert extra or unnecessary Skill Cards to other Skill Cards of the same rarity. When converted, you will receive a random Skill Card of the same rarity, except for the one that was converted. Also, you can convert unnecessary Skill Cards to credits.
Insufficient boosts to convert
You can convert extra or unnecessary boosts to higher-level boosts of the same type
Conversion to credits is available if the skill is fully improved

Reset or delete the account
"You can reset or delete the account. In this case:
• You'll forever lose all purchases
• Profile data for both factions will be deleted
• Your profiles will be removed from friend, recruit, and clan lists
• Profile nicknames will be changed to Deleted in Battle History and Hall of Fame
• Chat messages and support appeals will be deleted
If you reset the account, you'll start the game from the beginning with a new account. Purchases will not be transferred to the new account. It's impossible to restore a reset or deleted account.
"
Delete the account
Are you sure you want to delete the account? You'll lose all your progress. You won't be able to restore it.
Account deleted

General Assembly
Hey, Captain! A general assembly has been announced. You have nothing else to do in training camps. It's time to show yourself in action. Here are the assembly point coordinates. It's near Fort Kyten. The first group has left already. Get on to the next one. It's time to move!
Congratulations on your baptism of fire! Years spent in training camps were not in vain. You can proudly wear the rank of field commander. On the occasion of our first victory, General Monteros wants to make a speech. And subsequently, you will receive the next assignment.
{#5999<01>}
X Day
Today, we have challenged the system! Organized uprisings have sparked the whole world with the fire of hope! Hopes are for the overthrow of the Confederation's regime. Hidden too long in the shadows, we have suffered privation, gathered strength, and prepared for this day. It's time! Fight for freedom, brothers! Fight shoulder to shoulder! Our strength is unity! You will be led by experienced commanders, hardened in the Peruvian conflict. Follow their orders, and victory will be ours!

Complete 3 Tasks

A lot of our guys were killed during the assault, and we have to take every life into account! I suggest improving the soldiers' combat uniforms. This will require a bit of time and money.

Sir! Allow me to introduce myself. Lieutenant Natalie Jeanne, your secretary and assistant. I will help you take control of the battlefield. At first, follow the instructions and repair the Bunkers to repel the next attack.
Greetings, Commander. I am Anna Chasen, your Resistance liaison. I'll help you with administration. To begin with, follow the instructions and repair the Sniper Towers to repel the next attack.
Order infantry training in two Barracks at once to accelerate the preparation process.
You have a new job. You can view the mission assignments in the task window.

For ease of control, you can integrate units into groups to be able to select or focus on them quickly. Select an infantry unit and save them to a group.

A double tap will send selected units to a specified point in assault mode. In this mode, units attack all detected enemies on their way and continue moving to the destination point only after the enemy is destroyed.

Emergency repairs were completed. This method of repair quickly restores a building but requires numerous resources. Emergency repairs are unavailable while the building is under enemy fire. If the building is located inside the Construction Yard area, it will be repaired automatically at no cost.
To order {0}, select Barracks and tap on the {1} icon several times. Training takes some time and costs some resources.
{#9910<Assaults><Assault>}
{#9910<Riflemen><Rifleman>}
Containers with resources are discarded on battlefields before every battle. Use scouts to find these containers as quickly as possible. Each container gives you a good bonus for the development of your base deployment.
A resource container has been found! To pick it up, move any ground unit into the set area and tap on the container.
Our infantrymen can secretly move through the forest, unseen by enemy eyes. It gives us a significant tactical advantage over the Confederation infantry.
The Power Plant provides the base with energy. Without energy, it's impossible to construct buildings and produce units. Defensive structures don't function, either. The generation and consumption of energy are shown on the top information dashboard. Build additional Power Plants if more energy is needed.
Don't waste time while the base is under construction. Do reconnaissance. It will give you notice of enemy movement and help you discover additional resource containers.
Now that the base is supplied with energy, it's necessary to arrange a resource delivery system. To complete this, build a Supply Center.
Resources are needed for base construction and unit production. Each additional Supply Center provides fewer resources than the previous one.
Place the Barracks building at a location of your choice. To train units faster, build a few Barracks and order units in each of them.

For training {0}, we need to upgrade the Barracks to level 2. To do this, select the Barracks and tap the upgrade icon. While the upgrade is in progress, unit training stops. It will resume automatically after the completion of the upgrade.
{#9922<Heavy Assaults>}
{#9922<Grenadiers>}
You can upgrade the Headquarters to level 2. This will increase your Command Points, allowing you to manage more units. Headquarters energy and resource production will increase, too.
Boosts increase the different characteristics of units and buildings for a short period of time. To make a boost work, you must activate it. The boost selection button is on the left of the screen, below the mini-map. Only one boost can be activated at a time. The next boost activation will override the previous one's effect.
Tap the Boosts button and select "Common Attack". The boost will increase the damage caused by all units. Apply the boost upon the first contact with the enemy so the boost's time is used as effectively as possible.
At the beginning of a battle, you are given "Deployment Time", during which all buildings are being constructed in accelerated mode. Make optimal use of Deployment Time for a quick start. Deployment Time does not affect the speed of unit training and building upgrades.
Don't waste time while construction is in progress. Send a few {0} to find resource containers. Apply the “Infantry Scouting” boost. This will improve the characteristics of {1} and make them more effective on reconnaissance.
{#9929<Assaults><Assaults>}
{#9929<Riflemen><Riflemen>}
With powerful armor, the Bunker can effectively defend a base. Build some Bunkers near base entrances. This will delay the enemy's infantry for a while.
Thanks to its firing range and firepower, the Sniper Tower effectively defends a base. Build towers near base entrances. Snipers on the towers not only warn of approaching enemies, but also deal with attacking infantry.
You have a secondary assignment. You will gain an additional score to complete the mission with the best results.
To take control of the warehouse complex, you must capture the flag. After capturing it, secure the flag to prevent your enemy from getting it.
Capture the flag before the timer stops. Otherwise, the mission will end in failure. A captured flag gives you some advantages. To find out about them, tap on the flag.
The enemy seized the flag! Recapture it within the time specified; otherwise, the mission will end in failure.
Shooting accuracy decreases by half when firing at infantry sheltered in a forest. The visibility of the sheltered units themselves is also reduced by 2 cells. Snipers' firing range is also reduced by 2 cells.
Select a couple of infantrymen and command them to use "Observation.” In this mode, your soldiers will remain invisible in the forest and will not open fire on the enemy. Then guide them through the forest to the enemy base and steal the container.
The enemy has captured all the flags! Recapture at least one of them in the time specified, or the mission will end in failure.
Save the {0} squad to a group for better control. Use preset groups for quicker units control in a battle.
{#9941<Heavy Assault>}
{#9941<Grenadier>}
To select a saved group, simply tap on the group button. A second tap focuses on the group.
A long tap on the group button in use saves a new group instead of the previous one.
Check the surrounding villages, too. You may find volunteers who are interested in joining our army there.

“Cyclone” helicopters are ideal for reconnaissance operations. They are light, fast, and have good observation ability. The Cyclones are equipped with special scanners that can detect enemy infantry concealed in forests.
Helicopters fly low. They can be engaged by all ground units armed with machine guns or rockets.
To clear an area of mines, select {#86}Fortress[-], give it the {#83}demine[-] command, and specify a destination point. The Fortress will move to the specified point, neutralizing all mines along the way.
Thanks to its panoramic rocket launcher, Porcupines can fire on any enemy aircraft. A three-barrel machine gun allows you to hit not only air targets but ground targets as well.
Switch your Typhoons to the siege mode. It increases their effectiveness. After the attack is repulsed, be sure to switch them back to march mode.
The “Delta” amphibian can fight on both land and water. Landing on shore or descending into the water is possible only on gradual slopes along the shoreline. The Delta is produced at the Shipyard.
The “Torrent” MLRS has a greater firing range than the enemy's stationary guns, but can only fire in siege mode. The Torrent's firing range exceeds its sight range, so the use of reconnaissance units will help make Torrents more effective.
Don't leave Torrents unprotected, since they are vulnerable in close combat.
{0} fighters are very fast and maneuverable. They are effective against individual targets both on the ground and in the air. However, their combat flight duration is limited by their fuel supply.
The Confederation's “Zeus” tank is their most powerful assault weapon. Its thermoelectric gun, heavy armor, and anti-aircraft missile protection make Zeus a most universal unit. Zeus's only drawback is its low maneuverability.
Cyclones serve as excellent scouts. With their help, you can easily detect enemy troops and find the best route to attack.
{#9956<Vertex>}
{#9956<Hawk>}
A double tap on the unit allows you to select all units of this type on the screen. Select all {0}.
